thread.title: Two friends admit throwing foreign woman into river
thread.title_full: Two friends admit throwing foreign woman into river

title: Two friends admit throwing foreign woman into river
text:
More 
Two friends pleaded guilty in the Sessions Court in Shah Alam today to attempted murder by throwing a foreign woman into the Klang River last week. 
Mohamad Aidilfitri Mohd Powet and Mohd Afiq Jamli, both 21, made the guilty plea after the charge was read out to them before judge Slamat Yahya. 
Mohamad Aidilfitri and Mohd Afiq were alleged to have assaulted the 37-year-old woman, bound her legs and then placed her in a gunny sack before throwing it into the Klang River with the intention of killing her. 
The victim, who is a factory worker, was rescued by passers-by. 
The two men, both unemployed, were alleged to have committed the offence on Sungai Klang bridge, Kemuning-Shah Alam Expressway (LKSA), Section 24 here at about 11 am last Feb 6. 
They were charged under Section 307 of the Penal Code and face an imprisonment for up to 20 years, if found guilty. 
Slamat set March 15 for sentencing, following a request by the prosecution, conducted by deputy public prosecutor Naliatul Huzaimi Ab Rasip, pending the probation report on the accused from the Social Welfare Department. 
The two accused were denied bail. 
According to news reports, the men were unhappy with the woman's relationship with one of their relatives. 

- Bernama
